body: @amitdpawar ok, but please submit what you have so far so that we work on your most actual version
@jacek-lewandowski, I have pushed the changes and please check.

> > @amitdpawar - are you going to fix those remarks which you marked as resolved or you'd like me to help with it as well?
> 
> @amitdpawar I can also do some help to finish this task @jacek-lewandowski , just ping me as you want .

Thanks @Maxwell-Guo. I will seek your help after @jacek-lewandowski review.

@amitdpawar could you answer my question https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/2777#discussion_r1389237529 ?

I'll create a PR against your branch with changes I meant for the rest of the comments

> @amitdpawar could you answer my question [#2777 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/2777#discussion_r1389237529) ?
> 
> I'll create a PR against your branch with changes I meant for the rest of the comments

@jacek-lewandowski, I am OK. Otherwise, if you share those changes as a file then I can apply and push your change. Please do whatever is easy for you.

@amitdpawar here is the commit with the changes I propose - https://github.com/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/commit/1c51c0db1fce3979e89b8d22c64119f32258d2d5

Feel free to check it, I'll work on tests now (@Maxwell-Guo, any thoughts?)

> @amitdpawar here is the commit with the changes I propose - [jacek-lewandowski@1c51c0d](https://github.com/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/commit/1c51c0db1fce3979e89b8d22c64119f32258d2d5)
> 
> Feel free to check it, I'll work on tests now (@Maxwell-Guo, any thoughts?)

Thank @jacek-lewandowski , I just left some comments , I feel that most of your commits are great. There are only a few points where I may still be a little confused. For example, I prefer the hierarchical structure you mentioned, if this is not accept this time , I think commitlog_disk_access_mode may be better , As  direct io for log read when commitlog doing replay may finally be supported in the future , and different configuration for different disk access mode seems a bit redundant. As they seems are two big kind of configuration but hierarchical structure seem is only one .

As for correctness testing of DirectIOSegment, what about create a  log file ,and just write data , and using reader to fetch data and verify the correctness ?
Also I think we can add some stress test .
Let me know if you if i can do something for this , I think this is a great feature for c* .
I've pushed one more commit with DatabaseDescriptor test case;

The mailing list decided that by default we should use a legacy disk access mode (the same as it was selected in Cassandra 4 and prior). What do you think about tying it to `storage_compatibility_mode`? I mean, if `storage_compatibility_mode` is 4, then we use `legacy`, otherwise we use `auto`

cc @michaelsembwever

>  What do you think about tying it to `storage_compatibility_mode`? I mean, if `storage_compatibility_mode` is 4, then we use `legacy`, otherwise we use `auto`

Unless we have a clear understanding that SCM is not just compatibility but also default switching, I would not do that. That decision was something I was thinking of in CASSANDRA-18753, but it didn't appear to be something other people wanted, and there is no longer time to implement it.

Direct IO for the commit log will be part of the "latest" configuration provided by CASSANDRA-18753.
@belliottsmith Hi Benedict, have you had a chance to look at the comments that have been fixed? :-)

Given `test-latest` will test tries+oa we could remove all oa test specific jobs to spare CI cycles as they're redundant now?
Also shouldn't this ticket also enable all dtests, both python and jvm, with `latest`?

> Given test-latest will test tries+oa we could remove all oa test specific jobs to spare CI cycles as they're redundant now?

Actually, it will not test the the `big-oa` format but the `bti-da` one.

As for dtests, I'm still working on making the relevant changes.

Your 'latest' [does already run](https://github.com/blambov/cassandra/blob/CASSANDRA-18753/build.xml#L1281) with SCM `NONE` which is the same as running with `oa` feature-wise. Do we see value in testing `oa` by itself?

What I am trying to explain is that `latest` will already exercise the same code paths as `oa`...
`big-oa` is a separate sstable format, and it needs to be tested. Doing only base junit tests with it is likely sufficient; we can skip dtests (python or in-jvm) on it.
As `latest` will dtest `oa` current features that sounds like a good compromise to me, agreed.

@jacek-lewandowski, I tried limited testing and didn't see any issues. Didn't see commitlog disk mode in log file and looks like required. Liked your changes and would like to see these changes gets up-streamed to trunk sooner.

Unfortunately I found some issues with testing - not the production code, but it was unable to reset and reconfigure the commit log without restarting JVM - that should be fixed with the recent commits;

I'm running tests suite now: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1081/workflows/5c3290dc-5a70-47e0-9a98-23c1db07bbef

Interesting... in some tests `FileStore.getBlockSize` throws `UnsupportedOperationException`

https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1081/workflows/5c3290dc-5a70-47e0-9a98-23c1db07bbef/jobs/46760/tests

cc @blambov
Found a bug in size calculation as well. Removed `serializedRejection` and put the serialization of `maybeConsensusMigratedAt` at the end so it doesn't need to be repeated for accept/reject.

> Interesting... in some tests `FileStore.getBlockSize` throws `UnsupportedOperationException`
> 
> https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1081/workflows/5c3290dc-5a70-47e0-9a98-23c1db07bbef/jobs/46760/tests
> 
> cc @blambov

Could not identify why this exception is thrown. Is it possible to catch this exception also to get more detail?
Thanks @polandll! Let me know when that's done and I'll close this PR off without a merge. Appreciate the fast replies on this!

are we (and how) dtesting this config too ? (java and python dtests), separate ticket ?

^ https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/2896#issuecomment-1812084239

> As for dtests, I'm still working on making the relevant changes.

> Interesting... in some tests `FileStore.getBlockSize` throws `UnsupportedOperationException`
> 
> https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1081/workflows/5c3290dc-5a70-47e0-9a98-23c1db07bbef/jobs/46760/tests
> 
> cc @blambov

@jacek-lewandowski, @blambov any suggestion on these failures? Let me know if I need to do anything here or how to reproduce this issue?
It is very tempting to try to extract the repeated code into a function. But given the variations on the format string, the sequential numbering, etc it becomes a mess so I left it as it is...

Given CQLTester is widely used and sometimes cross-referenced the [j11](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/1121/workflows/3df2bb12-9795-4d4f-889a-1776fdffe8ad) CI is an extensive one. The [j17](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/1121/workflows/6b44a166-eaa5-4a1d-830c-25d82460bb5f) is just junit.
I think that in many cases it was that the tests which failed use jimfs in-memory FS which does not have that method implemented. We should probably disable direct I/O if we cannot get the block size
Good idea and I too have seen similar issue with ramdisk usage. Hopefully it passes.
Ok, running the tests again with the fix: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1097/workflows/d7e0ea82-2d28-4b5b-9154-c29c43355948

Thanks @jacek-lewandowski for fixing and starting the test. New failures are seen and looks like due to some minor issue.
Yeah, I'm going to address that today

I think I've found the issue, quite unexpected.
https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1104/workflows/495cb952-3714-4cb8-a7d1-e6990042b777
https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1105/workflows/ef61adb1-db4c-4000-9a93-88b84a85ad2c
rebased / rerunning tests after rebase https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1106/workflows/85fca87f-d4fe-44c6-ab28-d57cee7400a6

In the rerun after rebase I can see the repeated unit tests failing due to something weird - tests results show success but each worker fails with some infra-like problem:

```
++ ls build/test/logs/
+ [[ -n _jdk11 ]]
+ mv build/test/logs//_jdk11 /tmp/results/repeated_utests/logs/passes/01/
mv: cannot move 'build/test/logs//_jdk11' to '/tmp/results/repeated_utests/logs/passes/01/_jdk11': File exists

Exited with code exit status 1
```

but all runs finished successfully...

Also, after rebase one dtest failed - it did not fail before the rebase so I must investigate what happened... however it is weird as well:

https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1106/workflows/85fca87f-d4fe-44c6-ab28-d57cee7400a6/jobs/49107/tests

Besides : I found there are other failed tests ,because I was in a bit of an emergency at the moment, I didn't have time to find out the reason yet. I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s a problem with my local environment or configuration, or a problem with the test case itself:
These cases are : 
BatchCommitLogTest.testDeleteIfNotDirty
GroupCommitLogTest.testDeleteIfNotDirty
CommitLogChainedMarkersTest.replayCommitLogWithoutFlushing

And I have made some comments on the fix for other test failure that I have found.

I ran a simple test the duration time is 5m, direct io's  mean /95/99/999  latency is better than auto .
[simple_test_result.tar.gz](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/files/13456271/simple_test_result.tar.gz)

> I ran a simple test the duration time is 5m, direct io's mean /95/99/999 latency is better than auto . [simple_test_result.tar.gz](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/files/13456271/simple_test_result.tar.gz)

I don't know how it is possible - `auto` must have been resolved to something else than direct (that is easy to check in the logs, it explicitly says that the commitlog access mode was resolved to...).

(j11) https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1115/workflows/fd53b9c8-ee4d-4e25-8a06-2079f1732f8e ðŸŸ¡ 

`test_stop_failure_policy` passes locally and repeated run (100x) on this branch passed https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1120/workflows/4a9716c9-24c3-485f-9f11-bb596cbbca5f/jobs/50783/steps ðŸŸ¢ 

`test_shutdown_wiped_node_cannot_join` is flaky on both this branch (https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1118/workflows/0eb8dc23-980d-45bc-9fc6-890ea05941a9/jobs/50573/tests ðŸŸ¡ 
 13% flakiness) and on `cassandra-5.0` (https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1119/workflows/932a44e3-c25e-4c5e-b677-66579380faeb/jobs/50782/tests ðŸŸ¡ 
 17% flakiness), there is a ticket for this and links are 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-19097

Repeated unit tests seems to pass all tests but has some problems collecting logs - the same problem is present on `cassandra-5.0` - https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1114/workflows/a1d02a59-31ee-48e2-9426-a4eca52ed3ff/jobs/50107 ðŸŸ¡ and I've created a ticket for that: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-19086

I can see already that `test_stop_failure_policy` failed 1/100 in repeated run; therefore, I'm rerunning the repeated run on `cassandra-5.0` here: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1121/workflows/fce907b1-0526-4d4d-beb5-b6620737a5f3 ðŸŸ¡ - (failed 2/500, thus the test is flaky, creating ticket for it)
(j11) https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1122/workflows/a6889c2a-3b62-4f04-91e5-4a4e270a6368 ðŸŸ¡

In both builds there are many failures, most of them are mentioned in CASSANDRA-19055 (CEP-21 follow-up). For few others, I've run them locally on trunk and they failed, thus I've created tickets for them (CASSANDRA-19102, CASSANDRA-19101). 

The only thing left is `org.apache.cassandra.distributed.test.ReadRepairEmptyRangeTombstonesTest` - it failed once on CircleCI by timeout in teardown method of the entire class, when the cluster was being shutdown. It does not seem related. I could not reproduce it locally on either feature branch or trunk. Here https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/jacek-lewandowski/cassandra/1123/workflows/a62417d7-5ecf-4d4e-9303-ff05df3282c0/jobs/51273 I couldn't reproduce it on CircleCI as well. It might have been some infra problem I think.

Does this PR require any further testing?
@amitdpawar - no, we are just waiting for an agreement to merge it to cassandra-5.0 (see the thread on the mailing list)
Changes have already been merged.

> @amitdpawar - no, we are just waiting for an agreement to merge it to [cassandra-5](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-5).0 (see the thread on the mailing list)

Thanks @jacek-lewandowski for initiating and was waiting for this since long time. Is it possible for you to share the release schedule detail for RC, 5.0-beta1 and 5.0-beta2?
@amitdpawar I'm unable to answer those questions; you should ask @michaelsembwever, on dev channel or dev mailing list

> Is it possible for you to share the release schedule detail for RC, 5.0-beta1 and 5.0-beta2?

There's no such schedule.   We're trying to get betas out atm.

Merged as [128e704ec2500e37a0ee6847d151840976bcbb41](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/tree/128e704ec2500e37a0ee6847d151840976bcbb41)

> Plus we need to test the packaging in Jenkins

Jenkins does not work for pre-commit on 5.0 and trunk.
Jenkins just uses the in-tree scripts, and it has already been tested thoroughly with these (separately by both @shyla226 and myself)
Closed the committed patch
